channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A gang attack on a Haitian hospital reopening kills 2 reporters and a police officer
item.description: Street gangs forced the General Hospital in Port-au-Prince to close earlier this year. As journalists gathered to cover its reopening, suspected gang ...

item.title: Jackpot for Mega Millions surges past $1B after no numbers match on Christmas Eve drawing
Pope urges negotiations to end Ukraine-Russia war
item.description: The pontiff also called for a ceasefire in Gaza and the freeing of hostages held by Hamas.

item.title: Russia targets Ukrainian energy infrastructure on Christmas Day
item.description: Russia's massive missile and drone barrage struck a thermal power plant and prompted Ukrainians to shelter in metro stations on Christmas morning.

item.title: Plane crash in Kazakhstan killed dozens but some on board survived, officials say
item.description: Mobile phone footage circulating online appeared to show the Azerbaijani Airlines plane making a steep descent before slamming into the ground in a fi...

item.title: Trial of man accused in Trump assassination attempt in Florida pushed back to September
item.description: A man accused of attempting to assassinate President-elect Donald Trump in South Florida won’t be tried until September 2025. U.S.

item.title: Bald eagle officially declared US national bird after 250 years
item.description: The bird has been a national emblem in the US for years, but it never had an official status in the country's 248-year history.

item.title: 'The Bachelor,' Ukraine edition, features a veteran who lost both legs in the war
item.description: He wants to give hope to the tens of thousands of Ukrainians who have lost limbs since Russia's 2022 invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Owner and architect of Turkey quake collapse hotel jailed
item.description: They received hefty sentences after 72 people were killed when the building fell in the 2023 quake.

item.title: Biden signs a bill officially making the bald eagle the national bird of the US

item.title: Bridge collapse in Brazil leaves at least 2 dead, dozen missing
item.description: A bridge linking two northern states in Brazil collapsed, sending cars and trucks plunging into the river below. A sulphuric acid spill is complicatin...

item.title: Dozens survive Kazakhstan passenger plane crash
item.description: Kazakh authorities say 38 people were killed in the incident in western Kazakhstan.

item.title: Far from the front lines, Ukrainians fight a war to preserve their culture
item.description: In the Transcarpathia region, some locals embrace a traditional lifestyle and cultural identity. After surviving Soviet threats, now they fear Preside...

item.title: When kindness becomes a habit, it improves our health

item.title: With Biden's signature, bald eagle officially America's bird
item.description: President Biden signed legislation Christmas Eve to make the bald eagle officially the U.S. national bird.

item.title: King Charles gives thanks for his and Kate's cancer care

item.title: Zelensky condemns 'inhumane' Christmas Day attack
item.description: Russia has launched a major missile and drone attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure.
